title: IDF and Hezbollah continue trading attacks
Live Briefing: Drone ‘launched at’ Netanyahu’s home; North Gaza hospitals under fire, officials say
content: A drone was launched from Lebanon toward Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s residence in Caesarea area, officials said, adding that no casualties were reported.

content: As Israel and Hezbollah fight all around them, defiant villagers stay put in hopes their presence will deter attacks on their homes.

title: Cuban electrical collapse causes island-wide blackout, paralyzes economy
content: A growing energy crisis reached a crescendo Friday, as the country’s main power plant suddenly shut down, cutting off electricity to millions of Cubans.
summary: A growing energy crisis reached a crescendo Friday, as the country’s main power plant suddenly shut down, cutting off electricity to millions of Cubans.

title: Here are other key developments today
Live Briefing: Sinwar’s death offers ‘significant window of opportunity,’ Israeli president says
content: President Joe Biden said he has urged Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to “also make this moment an opportunity to seek a path to peace, a better future in Gaza without loss.”
summary: President Joe Biden said he has urged Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to “also make this moment an opportunity to seek a path to peace, a better future in Gaza without loss.”

title: IDF releases more details of Sinwar’s killing
‘The Empty Grave of Comrade Bishop’: Podcast episode guide
content: An episode guide: Grenada’s prime minister was executed in a coup in 1983. The location of his remains is unknown. New details reveal the role the U.S. played.
summary: An episode guide: Grenada’s prime minister was executed in a coup in 1983. The location of his remains is unknown. New details reveal the role the U.S. played.

title: Italy’s plan to detain migrants in Albania hits first legal obstacle
content: Italy’s far-right government wants to offshore the processing of asylum claims. But the first migrants sent to Albania were deemed ineligible for detention there.
summary: Italy’s far-right government wants to offshore the processing of asylum claims. But the first migrants sent to Albania were deemed ineligible for detention there.

title: South Korea says at least 1,500 North Korean special forces troops are in Russia
content: South Korea’s spy agency said the direct military cooperation between Russia and North Korea has been confirmed with its new evidence.
summary: South Korea’s spy agency said the direct military cooperation between Russia and North Korea has been confirmed with its new evidence.

title: London’s National Gallery bans liquids after activist art attacks
content: Activists have attacked artwork at the National Gallery in London five times, the gallery said. Just Stop Oil said the threat from climate change was much more serious.
summary: Activists have attacked artwork at the National Gallery in London five times, the gallery said. Just Stop Oil said the threat from climate change was much more serious.

title: The growing conflict between Canada and India, explained
content: India made a “horrific mistake” when it thought it could target opponents on Canadian soil, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said.

content: The World Health Organization said Israel provided no explanation for barring its partner organizations from the Strip, where the health-care system has collapsed.

title: Biden meets with world leaders amid uncertainty in Middle East and Ukraine
content: The U.S. leader also spoke of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar, the architect of the deadly Oct. 7, 2023, attack on Israel whose death was confirmed Thursday by the Israeli military.

The U.S.-Mexico border, the wall and the thousands of acres between them
content: Documents show the completion of the wall in the lower Rio Grande Valley would leave an area five times the size of Manhattan on the wrong side of the divide.
summary: Documents show the completion of the wall in the lower Rio Grande Valley would leave an area five times the size of Manhattan on the wrong side of the divide.

title: International telecom deal a sign of hope for Ukraine’s battered economy
content: The EBRD and IFC are providing a long-term loan of $400 million to investors for a telecom merger in the first major foreign investment since the Russian invasion.
summary: The EBRD and IFC are providing a long-term loan of $400 million to investors for a telecom merger in the first major foreign investment since the Russian invasion.

title: Former Olympic snowboarder accused of operating deadly drug enterprise
content: Authorities allege Ryan Wedding, who is believed to live in Mexico, and his organization moved about 60 tons of cocaine a year and orchestrated multiple murders.

title: U.S. charges former Indian spy linked to murder plot in New York
